definitions.text: that which is below standard or expectations as of ethics or decency
examples: take the bad with the good
his sloppy appearance made a bad impression
it was a bad light for reading
the movie was a bad choice

definitions.text: feeling physical discomfort or pain (`tough' is occasionally used colloquially for `bad')
examples: he was feeling tough after a restless night

definitions.text: (of foodstuffs) not in an edible or usable condition
examples: a refrigerator full of spoilt food

definitions.text: feeling or expressing regret or sorrow or a sense of loss over something done or undone
examples: felt regretful over his vanished youth
regretful over mistakes she had made
he felt bad about breaking the vase

definitions.text: below average in quality or performance

examples: anything that promises to pay too much can't help being risky

definitions.text: with great intensity (`bad' is a nonstandard variant for `badly')

examples: I wanted it badly enough to work hard for it
they were badly in need of help
he wants a bicycle so bad he can taste it
